title: Cave Hotels in Matera
text:
Expert Videos 
Matera, in southern Italy's Basilicata region, is famous for its sassi , a city of cave houses and churches dug out of soft tufa. A fascinating thing to do is to stay in the sassi in a cave hotel. Sassi hotels are in caves that have been renovated and modernized and normally have private baths, internet, air conditioning, and heating. 
These well-rated Matera cave hotels (or hotels with view of the sassi ) have links to Hipmunk , where you can see guest ratings and photos and search for the best prices for your dates. La Chiesa Room at Locanda di San Martino in Matera. James Martin, Europe Travel â€¢ Locanda di San Martino Hotel and Thermae 
Locanda di San Martino is a 3-star hotel set in a former church and cave houses in the sassi, very near Matera's city center. It has 28 rooms, each one unique and some with views, on four levels connected by passageways in the rock and an elevator. Rooms for four people are available. From the terraces and walkways there are good views of the sassi. There's also an unusual thermal pool.
